short_summary: Contractor is required to provide facilities and equipment to conduct collective military training role parade alongside other Collaborating to nations
tags: Short List Request for Tendering SI-C114-20SA0084
full_summary:
### Collective Military Training Role Playing and Facilities Tender Announcement

**Title**:
Collective Military Training role playing and facilities

**Reference Number**: W6399-21J415/C

**Publication Date**: November 17, 2022

**Tender Closing Date**: March 31, 2026 at 14:00:00 EST

**Amendment Date**: November 22, 2022

### Overview

The Department of National Defence (DND) requires contractors to provide facilities, equipment, and personnel to support collective training events in Canada and the United States. This Request for Supply Arrangements (RFSA) invites interested suppliers to submit a bid to pre-qualify for future Requests for Proposals (RFPs).

### Key Requirements

DND requires contractors to provide:

* Category 1: Land Exercise Effects
* Category 2: Specialized facilities, platforms, and equipment
* Category 3: Aviation Exercise Effects
* Category 4: Marine Exercise Effects
* Category 5: Cyber Exercise Effects
* Category 6: Exercise support
* Category 7: Subject matter experts

### Tender Details

* Trade Agreement: Covered by the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and other trade agreements.
* Tendering Procedure: This is an open bidding process; all interested suppliers may submit a bid.
* Competitive Procurement Strategy: Subsequent/Follow-on contracts.
* Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: Not applicable.

### Contact Information

* Name: Choquette, Herb
* Title: Not stated
* Telephone No.: (613) 449-8446
* Fax: (613) 545-8067
* Email: herb.choquette@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca

### Documents

The tender package is available for download from the Canada Buys website.

### Note

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Attachment

The tender documentation is attached to this announcement.

### Trade Agreements

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement
